Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11294667867/job/31415654933)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11294667867/job/31415655595)
Should this one be deprecated too?
zpow_ne_zero doesn't seem like the right replacement

The diff would be rather more readable if proofs that were on the next line stayed there:
```suggestion
theorem zpow_lt_iff_lt (hx : 1 < a) : a ^ m < a ^ n ↔ m < n :=
  zpow_lt_zpow_iff_right₀ hx
```
Also for example zpow_le_iff_le, zpow_inj

Because they are an easy consequence of existing lemmas, and because we don't have the analogous lemmas for literally every other strictly monotone/antitone function.

I am going through the API and adding missing lemmas and removing redundant ones. I have deemed those redundant. And as you see they are used exactly once.

```suggestion
variable [PosMulStrictMono G₀] {m n : ℤ}
```
(m and n seem to be used only once; not sure if it's worth putting them in a variable)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: generalise `zpow` lemmas from `LinearOrderedSemifield` to `GroupWithZero`
